svg.text: EMF induced is proportional to rate of change of magnetic flux
e(t) = Em sin(ωt + φ) = Em sin(2πft + φ)

g.text: • Used in power plants, large installations
• Used in wind turbines, small hydro plants
• Linear motion instead of rotational, wave power
• P = number of poles, N = speed in RPM

svg.text: • Concentrated solar power with steam turbines
Instantaneous EMF: e = Em sin(ωt) = Em sin(2πft)
P = poles, N = RPM, T = 1/f seconds
Mechanical power in: Pin = T × ω (watts)
Electrical power out: Pout = E × I × cos(φ)
